temperature.title: Temperature
temperature.content: M. bovis and M. caprae are slow-growing bacteria that need special culture media. Optimal growth occurs at 37°C. They are inactivated at the pasteurisation temperature: 63°C for 30' or 72°C for 15".

oxygen.title: Oxygen
oxygen.content: M. bovis and M. caprae are strictly aerobic but can survive in the presence of CO2 below 10%.

ph.title: pH
ph.content: M. bovis and M. caprae can survive very acidic pH, between 3 and 4. They grow optimally at pH between 5.8 and 6.9.

humidity.title: Water
humidity.content: M. bovis and M. caprae can survive in water more for than 200 days between 24°C and 28°C (room temperature).

salinity.title: Salinity
salinity.content: Salinity concentrations above 3% inhibit the growth of M. bovis and M. caprae.
